p: The effects of COVID-19 on agriculture have aggravated the risks of extreme food insecurity. Indeed, with the onset of COVID-19, an additional 130 million people could be pushed into starvation by the end of 2020, bringing the total to 265 million ( Lal, 2020). This information, reported in Table 2, confirms that epidemics and the sanitary measures necessary to mitigate their spread may have a negative impact on agriculture, as has already happened in the recent past with other epidemics ( Table 3 ).
